info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Spartanburg County through 500 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Spartanburg, or near USC Upstate, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spartanburg, Boiling Springs SC, Lyman, Wellford, Roebuck, Moore, USC Upstate, Croft State Park, Cedar Springs and Duncan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for Upstate South Carolina.
